metadata.title: CVE-2024-26993 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  fs: sysfs: Fix reference leak in sysfs_break_active_protection()  The sysfs_break_active_protection() routine has an obvious reference leak in its error path.  If the call to kernfs_find_and_get() fails then kn will be NULL, so the companion sysfs_unbreak_active_protection() routine won't get called (and would only cause an access violation by trying to dereference kn->parent if it was called).  As a result, the reference to kobj acquired at the start of the function will never be released.  Fix the leak by adding an explicit kobject_put() call when kn is NULL.
